name: Pidgey

attacks.name: Whirlwind
attacks.text: If your opponent has any Benched Pokémon, he or she chooses 1 of them and switches it with the Defending Pokémon. (Do the damage before switching the Pokémon.)

flavorText: A common sight in forests and woods. It flaps its wings at ground level to kick up blinding sand.

strengths: Whirlwind provides valuable disruption by forcing opponent switches
Colorless typing allows it to fit into any deck composition
Fighting resistance gives it durability against Fighting-type Pokemon
Low retreat cost of 1 provides flexibility in positioning
Evolves into the strong Pidgeotto which has excellent utility
weaknesses: Low 40 HP makes it vulnerable to one-hit knockouts
Lightning weakness is problematic against popular Electric Pokemon
Whirlwind's energy cost is high relative to its damage output
Opponent controls which benched Pokemon to switch in
Limited offensive capability on its own
synergies: Evolve quickly into Pidgeotto to access Mirror Move and higher HP
Use Whirlwind to bring out unprepared benched Pokemon for easy KOs
Pair with Gust of Wind for complete control over opponent's active Pokemon
Works well in stall decks to disrupt opponent's setup strategies
counters: Pikachu - Lightning weakness means quick knockouts
Electabuzz - Can one-shot Pidgey with ease
